summary:
Debby Gruiters is currently employed as general director of Panzi Foundation DRC, after 5 years as Head of Operations (Finance, Fundraising and HR) at the Dr. Denis Mukwege Foundation.

She has more than 20 years of experience in fundraising, finance, project management and donor compliance, and specialises in major international tender procedures and organizational compliance with eligibility requirements from a wide variety of donors, ranging from bilateral and multilateral donor institutions to private philanthropists and foundations (e.g. USAID, DGIS, the EU, UN agencies, Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, Conrad N. Hilton Foundation, DFID, AUSAID, AFDB, the World Bank, etc.).

She started her career as a European Project Manager in consulting firms in Rome, Italy, where she was responsible for setting up fundraising departments to obtain and subsequently manage EU funded research projects, mostly in the vocational education sector.

After 7 years she moved back to The Netherlands and started working for IRC International Water and Sanitation Centre. She set up and managed IRC's Business Development Unit for almost 10 years, coordinating IRC's efforts in diversifying its funding base, overseeing acquisition and proposal development, and introducing organizational compliance procedures.

'description': "IRC is an international think-and-do tank that works with governments, NGOs, entrepreneurs and people around the world to find long-term solutions to the global crisis in water, sanitation and hygiene services. At the heart of its mission is the aim to move from short-term interventions to sustainable water, sanitation and hygiene services.

With over 45 years of experience, IRC runs large-scale programmes in seven focus countries in Africa, Asia and Latin America and projects in more than 25 countries. It is supported by a team of around 80 staff across the world.

We want to cultivate a new way of working: delivering sustainable services through a comprehensive approach to water and sanitation. This involves underpinning services with financial planning that takes into account both the start up and the ongoing life cycle of the service. At the heart of much of this work is the development of people's competency and their capacity to maintain services. We encourage them to learn and continually adapt based on hard evidence of what works, not just now, but in 10, 20 and 30 years.", 'title': 'Programme Funding Coordinator', 'employment_type': None}]},
